description: Non-Material Amendment to Planning Permission ref: 20/02954/HOU (Demolition of existing north west wing, detached outbuilding, front steps and walls. Erection of side/front and rear/side single storey extensions to provide study, utility wing and pantry. Associated changes to fenestration) dated 18/01/2021. Amendments to alter size and roof design of pantry
decision_conditions: Condition 1 of 20/02954/HOU is amended to read as follows:The development to which this permission relates shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings and documents:A-100 Proposed Ground Floor PlanA-102 Proposed First Floor PlanA-103 Proposed Attic Floor PlanA-200 P1 Proposed North West and North East ElevationsA-200 Proposed North West ElevationA-201 Proposed North East ElevationA-202 Proposed South East ElevationA-203 Proposed South West ElevationA-210 Proposed Section AAD-100 Demolition PlansD-102 Demolition PlansD-103 Demolition PlansD-200 Demolition ElevationsD-201 Demolition ElevationsL-100 Location PlanL-101 Proposed Site PlanS-100 Existing Ground Floor PlanS-101 Existing First Floor PlanS-102 Existing Attic Floor PlanS-200 Existing ElevationsS-201 Existing ElevationsS-210 Existing Section AAReason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details have been assessed by relevant consultees and are hereby approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the approved details, in relation to Condition 3 (Samples) and 7 (Secure by Design) of planning permission 24/00400/FUL which states:Condition 3 - Prior to the commencement of any development above ground level, samples of the facing materials including roofing materail to be utilised in the development to which this permission relates shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The development shall then be carried out in accordance with the approved samples.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development, in accordance with policy D3 of the London Plan 2021 and policies CS8 and DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.Condition 7 - The development hereby permitted shall incorporate security measures to minimise the risk of crime and to meet the specific security needs of the development in accordance with Secured By Design. Details of these measures shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to commencement of the development and shall be implemented in accordance with the approved details prior to occupation. Reason: In order to achieve the principles and objectives of Secured by Design to improve community safety and crime prevention in accordance with Policy CS 14 of Kingston Core Strategy: Safer Communities, Policy DM 22 Design for Safety and D11 Designing out Crime of the London Plan 2021.

Heritage Statement - The site address is within the Grove Crescent Conservation Area, therefore please provide a Heritage Statement in line with the Validation Local List requirement (see pages 66-67).
